Applicant failed to mitigate the financial considerations security concerns alleged in this case. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-08105.h1 DATE: 10/20/2010

Case Number: 09-06267.h1
Financial

10/15/2010

Applicant incurred financial problems with his divorce and job loss in the last 10 years. As his income has stabilized, he has paid some of his past-due debts, resolved others, and pays three through monthly payments. He resolved all but one debt listed in the SOR. Applicant mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-06267.h1 DATE: 10/15/2010

Case Number: 09-06833.h1
Financial

10/08/2010

Applicant incurred financial problems after he married in 2006. His family size increased from three to seven. He purchased a larger home, but could not sell his smaller home. He paid two mortgages for a while, partly with the rental income from one property. His wife's job reduced her hours, and thus, her income. By late 2008, he could no longer pay all his bills. Both houses eventually sold, but for a significantly lower price than he paid. He does not owe the mortgage companies any additional money. He has a payment plan on his one remaining debt. He has mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-06833.h1 DATE: 10/08/2010

Case Number: 09-00268.h1
Foreign Preference, Foreign Influence, Personal Conduct

10/06/2010

Applicant has dual citizenship with the United States and Israel. His wife and adult children are U.S. citizens living in the United States. For nearly 40 years, he and distant family members have owned an undeveloped piece of property in Israel. He renewed his long-expired Israeli passport in 2006 and uses it to travel in and out of Israel. He owns two properties worth $56,000,000 in Israel, and he started an education foundation in Israel. He has not renounced his Israeli citizenship nor has he surrendered or destroyed his Israeli passport. He intentionally falsified his e-QIP and intentionally provided false information to the security clearance investigator. He has not mitigated the Government's security concerns about his foreign influence, foreign preference, and personal conduct. Eligibility for a security clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-00268.h1 DATE: 10/06/2010

Case Number: 09-06688.h1
Financial

09/30/2010

Applicant's financial problems began after he lost his job in 2007. He could not pay his credit card debt and his mortgage. The mortgagor obtained a foreclosure judgment against him in 2009. Applicant has not mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F because he did not provide sufficient evidence to show that he is not responsible for the debts alleged in the SOR. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-06688.h1 DATE: 09/30/2010

Case Number: 09-05680.h1
Financial

09/27/2010

Applicant incurred financial problems when the economy moved into a recession in 2008. Her husband operated a construction business and work stopped. They owned several rental properties. When their tenants lost their jobs, they stopped paying rent. Applicant stopped paying her mortgages. Applicant incurred the cost of evicting the tenants and additional property repair costs. With no income, she could not pay her debts. She sought employment and assistance with managing her finances. She filed for Chapter 7 bankruptcy. The court discharged her debts in June 2010. Applicant mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-05680.h1 DATE: 09/27/2010

Case Number: 10-00600.h1
Financial

09/17/2010

Applicant had an unblemished financial record until he became unemployed in March 2009. He sought Chapter 13 bankruptcy protection in December 2009, and he has remained current with all payments required under the Chapter 13 bankruptcy plan that was approved in March 2010. He has mitigated the financial considerations security concern that was alleged in this case. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 10-00600.h1 DATE: 09/17/2010

Case Number: 09-07654.h1
Foreign Preference

09/17/2010

Applicant mitigated the trustworthiness concerns that arose from his exercise of dual citizenship with Canada by his possession of a Canadian passport. Eligibility for access to sensitive information is granted. CASE NO: 09-07654.h1 DATE: 09/17/2010

Case Number: 09-07549.h1
Financial

09/14/2010

Applicant incurred financial problems after her husband's business partner absconded with the business equipment and checking account funds, which resulted in the close of his business. Since July 2007, her husband has worked five months and she did not work full-time until July 2009. The household income is significantly reduced, but sufficient to pay her current living expenses. She is working with an attorney to resolve her financial problems and with her mortgage company to refinance her loan. She has mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-07549.h1 DATE: 09/14/2010

Case Number: 09-08320.h1
Financial

08/27/2010

Applicant operated a business for 10 years. When the economy declined in 2008, his business also declined. He finally closed the business and sold its assets. The income from the asset sale did not pay all his business debts. He now works and has developed a plan to pay his debts. He has resolved some debts under his plan. He pays his current bills and lives within his financial means. He has mitigated the Government's security concerns under guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-08320.h1

Case Number: 09-04858.h1
Financial Considerations

08/19/2010

Applicant purchased a house in 2006 with her then boyfriend. After he ended their relationship and moved out, she continued to pay all the expenses of the house, exhausting her savings. With lost income and an ill father, she could not continue the mortgage payment. She allowed the house to go to foreclosure after the mortgagee did not grant her hardship request. The mortgagee has not responded to her requests to discuss the status of her property and the foreclosure. She pays her other bills and lives within her financial means. She has mitigated the Government's security concerns under guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-04858.h1 DATE: 08/19/2010

Case Number: 09-05904.h1
Drug Involvement, Personal Conduct, Criminal Conduct

08/17/2010

Applicant started smoking marijuana on a regular basis in college and continued to do so until January 2009. He has not used illegal drugs since January 2009 and lives many miles from his drug associates. He also used Adderol, a prescription drug, without a prescription. He intentionally lied on his e-QIP about his drug use. Applicant has mitigated the government's security concerns regarding his drug involvement. He has not mitigated the government's security concern about his personal conduct and criminal conduct. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-05904.h1 DATE: 08/17/2010

Case Number: 08-09965.h1
Criminal Conduct; Drugs; Personal Conduct

08/10/2010

Applicant is 30 years old. He used and purchased drugs multiple times in 2005. He was arrested twice in 2005. In 2007, he was arrested for carrying a pistol without a permit and possession of drug paraphernalia. He pled guilty to the drug paraphernalia offense and the other charge was dismissed after he provided proof he renewed his gun permit. Applicant was aware that the security clearance application required him to disclose if he had been arrested for a firearms offense. He intentionally failed to disclose this arrest on his security clearance application. When interviewed by a government investigator, he admitted that he did not disclose it because he did not want to "look bad." Applicant failed to meet his burden of persuasion to mitigate the security concerns under the Criminal Conduct, Drug Involvement, and Personal Conduct Guidelines. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 08-09965.h1

Case Number: 09-04269.h1
Alcohol; Drugs

08/09/2010

Applicant failed to mitigate the security concerns caused by her recent and long- term abuse of alcohol and her history of abusing a variety of controlled substances. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-04269.h1 DATE: 08/09/2010

Case Number: 09-02839.h2
Drug Involvement

07/30/2010

Applicant sporadically and infrequently smoked marijuana at social events in the seven years before submitting her security clearance application. She stopped her marijuana use and has signed a statement of intent not to use illegal drugs in the future and agreed to the automatic revocation of her security clearance if she does. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-02839.h2

Case Number: 09-04335.h1
Financial

07/16/2010

Applicant's financial problems began after he moved with his family to the west and he could not find steady employment at a reasonable salary. In January 2007, he began a reasonable paying job in his job field, but was laid off 17 months later. He has paid some of his debts, but still has a significant amount of unpaid debts. He has not mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-04335.h1 DATE: 07/16/2010

Case Number: 09-03725.h1
Financial Considerations

07/12/2010

Applicant defaulted on three mortgages between April 2007 and February 2008 when his finances declined because his mother died, he seriously injured his elbow in a car accident, and his work levels declined. The mortgagor for his two rental properties reclaimed the property through a deed-in-lieu of foreclosure, which resolved any indebtedness to the mortgagor. Under the state law where he resided at the time the mortgagor foreclosed on his personal residence, the mortgagor cannot collect any deficiency remaining on property after foreclosure. Applicant has mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-03725.h1

Case Number: 09-05387.h1
Financial Considerations, Alcohol Consumption

07/07/2010

Applicant's financial problems began when his business partnership failed in early 2006. He exhausted all of his financial resources, but could not pay all his debts. Since then he has worked sporadically, making it difficult to pay his debts. He has not provided evidence showing his financial losses and his efforts to repay his creditors. He consumed alcohol to excess to calm his fear of flying. On two occasions, the police arrested him for driving under the influence as he left the airport. Applicant has not been diagnosed as alcohol dependent nor as an alcohol abuser. After his 2006 arrest, he ceased using alcohol to calm his fears. Applicant mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline G, but he has not mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-05387.h1

Case Number: 09-03836.h1
Drug Involvement, Alcohol Consumption

07/07/2010

Applicant began consuming alcohol regularly at the age of 15. In 2001, he started smoking marijuana at parties and two years later, he began snorting cocaine at parties. He stopped his cocaine use in 2005 and his marijuana use in late 2007. In May 2008, he self- admitted to an inpatient substance abuse treatment facility because he had become concerned about his use of alcohol and drugs. He successfully completed both inpatient and outpatient treatment programs. He remains drug free and alcohol free. He agreed to the automatic revocation of his security clearance if he uses drugs in the future. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-03836.h1

Case Number: 08-07664.h2
Financial

07/07/2010

Applicant developed financial problems following his young daughter's diabetes diagnosis in 2004. He and his wife divorced in 2008, which also impacted his finances. Applicant provided documentary evidence which showed that he paid six of the eight debts listed in the statement of reasons. He, however, failed to provide evidence that indicates he is in compliance with a repayment plan on the largest SOR debt. He has not mitigated the government's security concerns under guideline F. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 08-07664.h2

Case Number: 08-12192.h1
Financial

05/28/2010

Applicant developed financial problems as a result of numerous moves, low income, unpaid child support, and medical bills. For over two years, Applicant has worked to resolve his overdue bills. He has paid many of his debts and is working to resolve the remaining debts. He has mitigated the Government's security concerns under guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 08-12192.h1 DATE: 05/28/2010

Case Number: 09-02736.h1
Financial

05/24/2010

Applicant incurred debts problems when medical providers failed to properly bill her insurance carrier for medical expenses , and after she left the Marines in 2006. Since leaving the Marines, Applicant has encountered difficulties obtaining work and when she did, she did not earn sufficient income to support herself and her two sons. Applicant initiated the paperwork for her health insurance carrier to pay the outstanding medical bills. She is resolving her child support arrearage and resolved several small debts. She lives frugally and within her financial means. She has mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-02736.h1 DATE: 05/24/2010

Case Number: 09-02496.h1
Financial, Personal Conduct, Criminal Conduct

05/17/2010

Applicant paid or resolved some of past due debts, but he still owes a number of old debts. Applicant intentionally falsified his answer on his SF-86 regarding overdue debts, which is felony under federal law, but did not falsify his answer to the status of his current debts. Applicant he has not mitigated the government's security concerns regarding his finances, personal conduct, and his criminal conduct. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-02496.h1 DATE: 05/17/2010

Case Number: 09-06308.h1
Financial Considerations

05/13/2010

Applicant incurred unpaid debts, because of job loss, underemployment, sporadic employment, and low wages. When deciding which debts to pay, Applicant chose to pay those debts which provided for his family. When his income improved at times, he paid some of his old debts, but not all. He established payment plans for two debts and paid another. He complies with the terms of his repayment plans, with one debt now resolved. Applicant has mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-06308.h1 DATE: 05/13/2010

Case Number: 09-04631.h1
Financial

04/27/2010

Applicant incurred significant debts when employees at his company went on strike in 2006. He obtained new employment and paid many of his debts. Although he got behind in his mortgage payments, he developed a forbearance plan with his mortgage. He paid more than $8,000 to the mortgagor; however, the mortgagor did not apply the money to his account. Applicant ceased many further payments and moved out of the house. Applicant has a purchaser for the house and is waiting approval of the sales contract. He resolved his smaller debts. He has mitigated the Government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-04631.h1 DATE: 04/27/2010

Case Number: 09-02294.h1
Financial

04/21/2010

Applicant incurred significant debts in 2002 and 2003. For the last seven years, she has successfully worked to resolve these debts. She still owes one debt, but cannot pay it as the owner of the debt is not known. She has mitigated the government's security concerns under Guideline F. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-02294.h1 DATE: 04/21/2010

Case Number: 08-12167.h1
Financial Considerations, Personal Conduct, Criminal Conduct

04/20/2010

Between 2001 and 2006, the police arrested and charged Applicant with driving while impaired on four occasions. After his 2006 arrest and subsequent trial, the court found him guilty and sentenced him to one year in jail. The police also arrested Applicant on numerous occasions for driving while his driver's license was revoked and on a tinted windows violation. After completing a Chapter 13 wager-earner's repayment plan, Applicant incurred additional debts, which are resolved. Applicant intentionally falsified his answers on his e-QIP regarding his criminal conduct, his finances, and substance abuse treatment. Applicant has mitigated the government's security concerns regarding his finances and criminal conduct, but he has not mitigated the government's security concerns regarding his personal conduct. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 08-12167.h1 DATE: 04/20/2010

Case Number: 08-06969.h1
Personal Conduct

04/13/2010

Applicant failed to advise his employer and the Government that his wife maintains two pornography websites, which include hardcore pornography. This decision places him in a position to be exploited, coerced or forced to provide classified information. He has not mitigated the government's security concerns. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 08-06969.h1 DATE: 04/13/2010

Case Number: 09-01463.h1
Criminal Conduct; Drug Involvement

03/31/2010

In March 2008, Applicant argued with a man at a gas station. When he felt threatened by the man, Applicant took a small knife out of his car and displayed it. He did not threaten the man. After he purchased his gas and left, the police stopped him, then arrested and charged Applicant with multiple criminal acts related to the gas station incident and one charge for possession of marijuana. Applicant used marijuana twice in January 2008 on social occasions. The State nolle prossed the first degree assault charge, Applicant pled guilty to reckless endangerment, a misdemeanor offense, the court placed the remaining four charges on the "STET" docket, and sentenced Applicant. Applicant has not had any other arrests nor has he used marijuana in two years. Applicant agreed to the automatic revocation of his security clearance if he used illegal drugs in the future. Applicant has mitigated the security concerns under Guideline H, but not Guideline J. Guideline H is found in favor of Applicant and Guideline J is found against Applicant. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-01463.h1

Case Number: 09-04087.h1
Financial

04/13/2010

Applicant lost a home to foreclosure in October 2008. The mortgagee reclaimed the property in settlement of the defaulted mortgage, but Applicant still owes about $57,364 for a defaulted home equity loan on that property. As of January 2010, he was attempting to resolve, through a short sale, mortgage and home equity loans totaling $283,000 on another property. Because he is paying more than $750 in monthly minimum payments on about $21,828 in credit card debt, Applicant does not have the funds to resolve his financial issues in the near future. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-04087.h1

Case Number: 09-01570.h1
Financial; Personal Conduct

05/25/2010

Applicant began accumulating a significant amount of debt in late 2002 after he was laid off from work for two years. In addition, he went through a litigious divorce in 2003, incurred many bills for a disable son, and became obligated to pay child support for nine children. He is resolving a large tax lien and sufficiently disputed another debt. To date, about $7,800 of delinquent debt alleged in the Statement of Reasons remains unresolved because he does not have sufficient money in his budget to pay it after paying child support. He admitted that he used marijuana in late 2001 in his security clearance application. However, throughout the security clearance process, he has not been forthright about the extent of that usage. He mitigated the security concerns raised under the financial considerations guideline. He failed to mitigate those concerns raised under the personal conduct guideline. Clearance is denied.

Case Number: 08-10351.h1
Personal Conduct

10/19/2010

Applicant has rebutted or mitigated the security concerns under personal conduct related to his overseas employment and completion of security clearance questionnaires. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 08-10351.h1

Case Number: 09-06735.h1
Foreign Influence, Financial, Personal Conduct

08/24/2010

Applicant is a naturalized U.S. citizen who was born in Liberia. His fianc‚e is a citizen of Liberia, and a U.S. permanent resident. He has two friends in Liberia, but the extent and nature of their relationship is unknown. Liberia has cordial relations with the United States, and the file contains no evidence that it targets or collects protected U.S. information. Security concerns related to foreign influence are mitigated. Applicant accumulated delinquent debts from 2006 to 2009, totaling almost $18,000. Although he claims to have paid several, Applicant provided no supporting documentation. They are currently unpaid, with no payment plan in place to resolve them. Applicant admits that he deliberately failed to inform the government of the extent of his debts. Security concerns related to financial considerations and personal conduct are not mitigated. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-06735.h1

Case Number: 09-05212.h1
Foreign Influence

11/22/2010

Applicant is 47 years old. He was born in Jordan and became a U.S. citizen in 2007. His wife and youngest child are U.S. citizens. His parents, three siblings, first wife, and two oldest children are Jordanian citizens and residents. He has a sibling who is a Jordanian citizen and a resident of Qatar and a sibling who is a Jordanian citizen and a resident of the UAE. Applicant performed important and dangerous duty as a linguist in Iraq. He has mitigated Foreign Influence security concerns. Clearance is granted. CASE NO: 09-05212.h1

Case Number: 09-05515.h1
Financial

06/17/2010

Applicant failed to mitigate the security concern created by his history of financial irresponsibility which has not been resolved. Clearance is denied. CASE NO: 09-05515.h1
